sentence: Now, we all know access to food is a human right.

sentence: Speaker, we all know that right now the housing crisis  is real for so many of our families across the country, and I know many  of us in this Chamber, especially those on the left, have always said  housing is a human right.
title: Housing is A Human Right

sentence: Healthcare is a human right, and your ability to get it shouldn't  depend on how much you earn, where you live, or whether your employer  offers coverage.

sentence: I believe that healthcare is a human right.

sentence: On behalf of Illinois' Third Congressional District, it is my honor  to commend Eric Sirota for his work to ensure safe, just, and  affordable housing as a fundamental human right.

sentence: I will start by saying to you  unapologetically and very loudly that I believe to my core that  healthcare is a human right.
title: Defending Social Services and Programs

sentence: And the Affordable Care Act recognizes that healthcare in  America, aspirationally, should be a human right.
title: Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2026

sentence: A human  right to 1.3 million children in Georgia, quarter of a million Georgian  seniors, over 37 million kids nationwide, 9.3 million seniors  nationwide--why should they go to bed tonight wondering if the Congress  is getting ready to pull the rug out from under them?
title: H. Con. Res. 14

sentence: Everybody needs  healthcare, and it should be regarded as a human right.

sentence: I want people to look at this and pay attention because they will  never, ever fully fund Medicaid, universal school meals for every  hungry child, or guarantee healthcare as a human right in our country.
title: Taxing Excessive Ceo Pay

sentence:
Paul Farmer--extraordinary leader, physician, anthropologist,  renowned humanitarian, pioneer of global health--I read his book  ``Mountains Beyond Mountains.'' In another one of his books,  ``Pathologies of Power: Health, Human Rights, and the New War on the  Poor,'' he wrote:

If access to healthcare is considered a human right, who is       considered human enough to have that right?
title: Privileges of the Floor
